content.text:
I'll help you explore the current directory structure. Let me start by checking what's in the working directory and then provide a comprehensive overview.

<tool_code>
Bash
command: pwd
description: Print current working directory
</tool_code>

<tool_code>
Bash
command: ls -la
description: List all files and directories in current location
</tool_code>

<tool_code>
Bash
command: find /home/esegnorelli -maxdepth 2 -type f -name "*.py" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.jsx" -o -name "*.tsx" -o -name "*.md" -o -name "*.json" | head -20
description: Find common code and documentation files in home directory
</tool_code>

<tool_code>
Bash
command: du -sh /home/esegnorelli/* 2>/dev/null | sort -hr | head -10
description: Check directory sizes to identify largest directories
</tool_code>
